trans-unit.source: Explore .NET trace logs in Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Explore .NET trace logs in Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Search logs generated with Trace, NLog, or Log4Net.
trans-unit.target: Search logs generated with Trace, NLog, or Log4Net.

trans-unit.source: Explore .NET trace logs in Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Explore .NET trace logs in Application Insights

trans-unit.source: If you use NLog, log4Net or System.Diagnostics.Trace for diagnostic tracing in your ASP.NET application, you can have your logs sent to [Visual Studio Application Insights][start], where you can explore and search them.
trans-unit.target: If you use NLog, log4Net or System.Diagnostics.Trace for diagnostic tracing in your ASP.NET application, you can have your logs sent to [Visual Studio Application Insights][start], where you can explore and search them.

trans-unit.source: Your logs will be merged with the other telemetry coming from your application, so that you can identify the traces associated with servicing each user request, and correlate them with other events and exception reports.
trans-unit.target: Your logs will be merged with the other telemetry coming from your application, so that you can identify the traces associated with servicing each user request, and correlate them with other events and exception reports.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Do you need the log capture module?
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Do you need the log capture module?

trans-unit.source: It's a useful adapter for 3rd-party loggers, but if you aren't already using NLog, log4Net or System.Diagnostics.Trace, consider just calling [Application Insights TrackTrace()](app-insights-api-custom-events-metrics.md#track-trace) directly.
trans-unit.target: It's a useful adapter for 3rd-party loggers, but if you aren't already using NLog, log4Net or System.Diagnostics.Trace, consider just calling [Application Insights TrackTrace()](app-insights-api-custom-events-metrics.md#track-trace) directly.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't yet [set up Application Insights for your project][start], do that now.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't yet [set up Application Insights for your project][start], do that now.

trans-unit.source: Your project should have the file `ApplicationInsights.config` and the NuGet package `Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web`.
trans-unit.target: Your project should have the file `ApplicationInsights.config` and the NuGet package `Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web`.

trans-unit.source: Install an adapter for your logging framework
trans-unit.target: Install an adapter for your logging framework

trans-unit.source: If you use a logging framework - log4Net, NLog or System.Diagnostics.Trace - you can install an adapter that sends these logs to Application Insights along with other telemetry.
trans-unit.target: If you use a logging framework - log4Net, NLog or System.Diagnostics.Trace - you can install an adapter that sends these logs to Application Insights along with other telemetry.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to use log4Net or NLog, install it in your project.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to use log4Net or NLog, install it in your project.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click your project and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click your project and choose **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: Search for "Application Insights"
trans-unit.target: Search for "Application Insights"

trans-unit.source: Get the prerelease version of the appropriate adapter
trans-unit.target: Get the prerelease version of the appropriate adapter

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate package - one of:
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate package - one of:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceListener (to capture System.Diagnostics.Trace calls)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceListener (to capture System.Diagnostics.Trace calls)

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.NLogTarget
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.NLogTarget

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Log4NetAppender
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Log4NetAppender

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package installs the necessary assemblies, and also modifies web.config or app.config.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package installs the necessary assemblies, and also modifies web.config or app.config.

trans-unit.source: Insert diagnostic log calls
trans-unit.target: Insert diagnostic log calls

trans-unit.source: If you use System.Diagnostics.Trace, a typical call would be:
trans-unit.target: If you use System.Diagnostics.Trace, a typical call would be:

trans-unit.source: If you prefer log4net or NLog:
trans-unit.target: If you prefer log4net or NLog:

trans-unit.source: Using the Trace API directly
trans-unit.target: Using the Trace API directly

trans-unit.source: You can call the Application Insights trace API directly.
trans-unit.target: You can call the Application Insights trace API directly.

trans-unit.source: The logging adapters use this API.
trans-unit.target: The logging adapters use this API.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: An advantage of TrackTrace is that you can put relatively long data in the message.
trans-unit.target: An advantage of TrackTrace is that you can put relatively long data in the message.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could encode POST data there.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could encode POST data there.

trans-unit.source: Explore your logs
trans-unit.target: Explore your logs

trans-unit.source: In your app's overview blade in [the Application Insights portal][portal], choose [Search][diagnostic].
trans-unit.target: In your app's overview blade in [the Application Insights portal][portal], choose [Search][diagnostic].

trans-unit.source: In Application Insights, choose Search
trans-unit.target: In Application Insights, choose Search

trans-unit.source: Diagnostic Search
trans-unit.target: Diagnostic Search

trans-unit.source: You can, for example:
trans-unit.target: You can, for example:

trans-unit.source: Filter on log traces, or on items with specific properties
trans-unit.target: Filter on log traces, or on items with specific properties

trans-unit.source: Inspect a specific item in detail.
trans-unit.target: Inspect a specific item in detail.

trans-unit.source: Find other telemetry relating to the same user request (that is, with the same OperationId)
trans-unit.target: Find other telemetry relating to the same user request (that is, with the same OperationId)

trans-unit.source: Save the configuration of this page as a Favorite
trans-unit.target: Save the configuration of this page as a Favorite

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: [Diagnose failures and exceptions in ASP.NET][exceptions]
trans-unit.target: [Diagnose failures and exceptions in ASP.NET][exceptions]

trans-unit.source: [Learn more about Diagnostic Search][diagnostic].
trans-unit.target: [Learn more about Diagnostic Search][diagnostic].

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: I get an error "Instrumentation key cannot be empty"
trans-unit.target: I get an error "Instrumentation key cannot be empty"

trans-unit.source: Looks like you installed the logging adapter Nuget package without installing Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Looks like you installed the logging adapter Nuget package without installing Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click `ApplicationInsights.config` and choose **Update Application Insights**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click `ApplicationInsights.config` and choose **Update Application Insights**.

trans-unit.source: You'll get a dialog that invites you to sign in to Azure and either create an Application Insights resource, or re-use an existing one.
trans-unit.target: You'll get a dialog that invites you to sign in to Azure and either create an Application Insights resource, or re-use an existing one.

trans-unit.source: That should fix it.
trans-unit.target: That should fix it.

trans-unit.source: I can see traces in diagnostic search, but not the other events
trans-unit.target: I can see traces in diagnostic search, but not the other events

trans-unit.source: It can sometimes take a while for all the events and requests to get through the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: It can sometimes take a while for all the events and requests to get through the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: How much data is retained?
trans-unit.target: How much data is retained?

trans-unit.source: Up to 500 events per second from each application.
trans-unit.target: Up to 500 events per second from each application.

trans-unit.source: Events are retained for seven days.
trans-unit.target: Events are retained for seven days.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: [Set up availability and responsiveness tests][availability]

trans-unit.target: [Troubleshooting][qna]

trans-unit.target: test
